title: Module 3 Quiz: Implementing AI in Your Business

questions.question: According to the AI readiness framework, which dimension is often the most significant gap for NZ SMEs?
questions.questionHtml: According to the AI readiness framework, which dimension is often the most significant gap for NZ SMEs?

answers.text: Strategic clarity
answers.textHtml: Strategic clarity

answers.text: Data foundations
answers.textHtml: Data foundations

answers.text: Technology infrastructure
answers.textHtml: Technology infrastructure

answers.text: Financial resources
answers.textHtml: Financial resources

questions.feedback: Data quality is often the most significant gap for NZ SMEs. Common issues include information scattered across spreadsheets, emails, and paper; inconsistent data entry practices; missing historical data; and poor integration between systems. Good data foundations are essential for AI tools to work effectively.
questions.feedbackHtml: Data quality is often the most significant gap for NZ SMEs. Common issues include information scattered across spreadsheets, emails, and paper; inconsistent data entry practices; missing historical data; and poor integration between systems. Good data foundations are essential for AI tools to work effectively.

questions.question: When evaluating AI tools, which criteria should SMEs consider? (Select all that apply)
questions.questionHtml: When evaluating AI tools, which criteria should SMEs consider? (Select all that apply)

answers.text: Problem-solution fit
answers.textHtml: Problem-solution fit

answers.text: Integration with existing systems like Xero
answers.textHtml: Integration with existing systems like Xero

answers.text: Number of AI features offered
answers.textHtml: Number of AI features offered

answers.text: Vendor viability and support availability
answers.textHtml: Vendor viability and support availability

questions.feedback: The tool selection framework includes problem-solution fit, ease of use, integration capability, cost and value, security and privacy, vendor viability, and support. Number of features is NOT a recommended criterion—choosing tools for features you'll never use rather than ones that solve actual problems is listed as a common selection mistake.
questions.feedbackHtml: The tool selection framework includes problem-solution fit, ease of use, integration capability, cost and value, security and privacy, vendor viability, and support. Number of features is NOT a recommended criterion—choosing tools for features you'll never use rather than ones that solve actual problems is listed as a common selection mistake.

questions.question: What is a common reason technology implementations fail according to the change management lesson?
questions.questionHtml: What is a common reason technology implementations fail according to the change management lesson?

answers.text: The technology itself is poorly designed
answers.textHtml: The technology itself is poorly designed

answers.text: Human factors like resistance to change and inadequate training
answers.textHtml: Human factors like resistance to change and inadequate training

answers.text: Lack of budget for premium AI tools
answers.textHtml: Lack of budget for premium AI tools

answers.text: NZ's slow internet connectivity
answers.textHtml: NZ's slow internet connectivity

questions.feedback: Research consistently shows that technology projects fail more often from human factors than technical ones. For AI specifically, this includes fear about job displacement, skill gaps and lack of confidence, habit disruption, and unclear benefits to staff. Even in small teams, resistance can sabotage implementation.
questions.feedbackHtml: Research consistently shows that technology projects fail more often from human factors than technical ones. For AI specifically, this includes fear about job displacement, skill gaps and lack of confidence, habit disruption, and unclear benefits to staff. Even in small teams, resistance can sabotage implementation.

questions.question: Under New Zealand's Privacy Act 2020, what must businesses do regarding automated decision-making?
questions.questionHtml: Under New Zealand's Privacy Act 2020, what must businesses do regarding automated decision-making?

answers.text: Never use AI for any decisions affecting individuals
answers.textHtml: Never use AI for any decisions affecting individuals

answers.text: Tell people when decisions are made by AI and allow human review of significant decisions
answers.textHtml: Tell people when decisions are made by AI and allow human review of significant decisions

answers.text: Register all AI systems with the Privacy Commissioner
answers.textHtml: Register all AI systems with the Privacy Commissioner

answers.text: Only use AI tools developed in New Zealand
answers.textHtml: Only use AI tools developed in New Zealand

questions.feedback: The Privacy Act 2020 requires transparency about automated decisions affecting individuals. Businesses must tell people when decisions are made by AI, explain the general logic involved, and allow human review of significant automated decisions. The Act doesn't ban AI decision-making but requires appropriate safeguards.
questions.feedbackHtml: The Privacy Act 2020 requires transparency about automated decisions affecting individuals. Businesses must tell people when decisions are made by AI, explain the general logic involved, and allow human review of significant automated decisions. The Act doesn't ban AI decision-making but requires appropriate safeguards.

questions.question: What happened when Bay of Plenty Electrical Services initially implemented AI tools for quoting and scheduling?
questions.questionHtml: What happened when Bay of Plenty Electrical Services initially implemented AI tools for quoting and scheduling?

answers.text: The tools worked perfectly from day one with high adoption
answers.textHtml: The tools worked perfectly from day one with high adoption

answers.text: The tools were barely being used two months in due to staff resistance
answers.textHtml: The tools were barely being used two months in due to staff resistance

answers.text: The technology failed completely and had to be abandoned
answers.textHtml: The technology failed completely and had to be abandoned

answers.text: Staff immediately embraced the new AI capabilities
answers.textHtml: Staff immediately embraced the new AI capabilities

questions.feedback: The case study showed that two months after implementation, the AI tools were barely being used. Experienced electricians were skeptical about 'computer quoting', admin staff worried about job loss, and the owner was frustrated. After a turnaround approach focusing on change management—listening to concerns, addressing job security, involving skeptics, and starting smaller—they achieved full team adoption after 6 months.
questions.feedbackHtml: The case study showed that two months after implementation, the AI tools were barely being used. Experienced electricians were skeptical about 'computer quoting', admin staff worried about job loss, and the owner was frustrated. After a turnaround approach focusing on change management—listening to concerns, addressing job security, involving skeptics, and starting smaller—they achieved full team adoption after 6 months.

questions.question: Which of the following are ethical principles for AI use mentioned in the course? (Select all that apply)
questions.questionHtml: Which of the following are ethical principles for AI use mentioned in the course? (Select all that apply)

answers.text: Transparency - being open about when and how you use AI
answers.textHtml: Transparency - being open about when and how you use AI

answers.text: Fairness - AI should not discriminate or produce unfair outcomes
answers.textHtml: Fairness - AI should not discriminate or produce unfair outcomes

answers.text: Maximisation - using AI in as many areas as possible
answers.textHtml: Maximisation - using AI in as many areas as possible

answers.text: Accountability - humans remain responsible for AI outcomes
answers.textHtml: Accountability - humans remain responsible for AI outcomes

questions.feedback: The ethical principles for AI use covered in the course are: Transparency (being open about AI use), Fairness (avoiding discrimination), Accountability (humans responsible for outcomes), Privacy (protecting personal information), and Human Dignity (supporting human flourishing). Maximisation is NOT a principle—the course emphasises strategic, appropriate AI use, not using AI everywhere possible.
questions.feedbackHtml: The ethical principles for AI use covered in the course are: Transparency (being open about AI use), Fairness (avoiding discrimination), Accountability (humans responsible for outcomes), Privacy (protecting personal information), and Human Dignity (supporting human flourishing). Maximisation is NOT a principle—the course emphasises strategic, appropriate AI use, not using AI everywhere possible.

questions.question: What is 'demo seduction' in the context of AI tool selection?
questions.questionHtml: What is 'demo seduction' in the context of AI tool selection?

answers.text: Vendors refusing to provide product demonstrations
answers.textHtml: Vendors refusing to provide product demonstrations

answers.text: Being swayed by polished demonstrations rather than hands-on experience
answers.textHtml: Being swayed by polished demonstrations rather than hands-on experience

answers.text: A technique for negotiating better pricing
answers.textHtml: A technique for negotiating better pricing

answers.text: Using AI to create sales presentations
answers.textHtml: Using AI to create sales presentations

questions.feedback: Demo seduction is a common selection mistake where businesses are swayed by polished vendor demonstrations rather than hands-on experience with the tool. Demos show best cases while trials reveal reality. The recommendation is to request hands-on trials and have non-technical staff test the interface before making decisions.
questions.feedbackHtml: Demo seduction is a common selection mistake where businesses are swayed by polished vendor demonstrations rather than hands-on experience with the tool. Demos show best cases while trials reveal reality. The recommendation is to request hands-on trials and have non-technical staff test the interface before making decisions.

questions.question: According to the future-proofing lesson, what creates sustainable AI competitive advantage for SMEs?
questions.questionHtml: According to the future-proofing lesson, what creates sustainable AI competitive advantage for SMEs?

answers.text: Adopting AI tools before competitors do
answers.textHtml: Adopting AI tools before competitors do

answers.text: Combining AI efficiency with human expertise and judgment
answers.textHtml: Combining AI efficiency with human expertise and judgment

answers.text: Using the most expensive AI tools available
answers.textHtml: Using the most expensive AI tools available

answers.text: Replacing as many staff as possible with AI
answers.textHtml: Replacing as many staff as possible with AI

questions.feedback: Sustainable AI advantage comes from combining AI with human expertise, not replacing humans. AI commoditises routine tasks but amplifies human expertise. The combination of AI efficiency and human insight—judgment, creativity, and relationships—creates lasting value that competitors can't easily replicate.
questions.feedbackHtml: Sustainable AI advantage comes from combining AI with human expertise, not replacing humans. AI commoditises routine tasks but amplifies human expertise. The combination of AI efficiency and human insight—judgment, creativity, and relationships—creates lasting value that competitors can't easily replicate.

questions.question: What are 'AI agents' as described in emerging AI trends?
questions.questionHtml: What are 'AI agents' as described in emerging AI trends?

answers.text: Sales representatives who specialise in selling AI products
answers.textHtml: Sales representatives who specialise in selling AI products

answers.text: AI systems that can complete multi-step tasks autonomously, not just answer questions
answers.textHtml: AI systems that can complete multi-step tasks autonomously, not just answer questions

answers.text: Consultants who help businesses implement AI
answers.textHtml: Consultants who help businesses implement AI

answers.text: AI tools designed specifically for government agencies
answers.textHtml: AI tools designed specifically for government agencies

questions.feedback: AI agents represent an emerging trend where AI moves from answering questions to taking actions. AI agents can complete multi-step tasks autonomously—handling complex processes end-to-end with less human intervention needed for routine workflows. This creates new roles for humans in supervising rather than executing AI work.
questions.feedbackHtml: AI agents represent an emerging trend where AI moves from answering questions to taking actions. AI agents can complete multi-step tasks autonomously—handling complex processes end-to-end with less human intervention needed for routine workflows. This creates new roles for humans in supervising rather than executing AI work.

questions.question: What Te Ao Māori concept relates to being a good guardian of data in AI systems?
questions.questionHtml: What Te Ao Māori concept relates to being a good guardian of data in AI systems?

answers.text: Manaakitanga
answers.textHtml: Manaakitanga

answers.text: Whanaungatanga
answers.textHtml: Whanaungatanga

answers.text: Kaitiakitanga
answers.textHtml: Kaitiakitanga

answers.text: Tikanga
answers.textHtml: Tikanga

questions.feedback: Kaitiakitanga relates to guardianship and being a good guardian of data. The course mentions considering whether AI applications align with tikanga values including: Manaakitanga (care for people), Kaitiakitanga (guardianship of data), and Whanaungatanga (supporting relationships). Tikanga is the broader term for customary practices.
questions.feedbackHtml: Kaitiakitanga relates to guardianship and being a good guardian of data. The course mentions considering whether AI applications align with tikanga values including: Manaakitanga (care for people), Kaitiakitanga (guardianship of data), and Whanaungatanga (supporting relationships). Tikanga is the broader term for customary practices.
